metadata.title: CVE-2020-9843 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An input validation issue was addressed with improved input validation.This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS6.2.5, Safari 13.1.1, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2,iCloud for Windows 7.19. Processing maliciously crafted web content maylead to a cross site scripting attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9843` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.28.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
